\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Generate a list of customer ratings with names and ratings.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
max (int): The maximum number of customer ratings to generate.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{list: A list of customer ratings. Each customer rating is a dictionary }
\sphinxAtStartPar
with keys “name” and “rating”.

\end{description}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\index{get\_data() (in module main)@\spxentry{get\_data()}\spxextra{in module main}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{main:main.get_data}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{main.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_data}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Reads the menu.csv file and returns the data in a list of lists format.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The data is modified to include a row number, the average rating and the total number of customer ratings.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
list: A list of lists where each inner list represents a row in the menu.csv file.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{show\_data() (in module main)@\spxentry{show\_data()}\spxextra{in module main}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{main:main.show_data}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{main.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{show\_data}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{data}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Displays the data in a tabular format with the total number of customer ratings.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{data (list): A list of lists containing menu data. The first element is the header, }
\sphinxAtStartPar
and subsequent elements are rows containing menu item information.

\end{description}

\sphinxlineitem{Modifies:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Replaces the ‘customer\_rating’ column with the count of customer ratings 
and updates the header to ‘total\_customer\_ratings’.

\sphinxlineitem{Prints:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The formatted table with updated customer ratings count.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}
